credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Inkstand with victory column flanked by figures of fame on top of military trophies
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
description: Vertical rectangle. Shown slightly from above. Below is a dodecagonal pedestal, formed by a broad oval with protruding squares in the middles of the ends. It is supported by eight obliquely disposed claws. The covers of the bowls show female genii standing above trophies of arms. Both are blowing trumpets. They hold with their inside hands, teh left one a standard, the right one a wreath. In the cener rises a monumental column. Below aer three steps. A relief is shown in the pedestal. Eagles stand obliquely at the corners beside the base. A sceptre and a wreath are fastened by another, a laurel wreath to the shaft. Above stands a general upon a globe which is supported by sitting slaves. Colored background. (RB'45)
name: Drawing
